text.title: U S CORPORATE FINANCE S P CUT HAS NO EFFECT
text.author: By John Picinich Reuters
text.body: In unusual move Standard Poor s Corp downgraded U S corporate debt issue soon after priced offering late week But unlike similar action September investment bankers disrupted financing agency s rate reduction no effect time traders S P announced Friday afternoon cut to B B plus dlr issue senior notes due Holiday Inns Inc unit Holiday Corp HIA notes were priced late Thursday by sole manager Drexel Burnham Lambert Inc release Standard Poor s action reflected change note issue s terms to unsecured form debt secured change made after agency rated notes on February S P stated We took action as we became aware issue s structure changed Robert Nelson S P We generally make distinction between secured unsecured debt key factor our downgrade spokesman Drexel action did affect Holiday Inns deal already sold out to investors by late Friday afternoon The Holiday notes trading at on when issued basis Drexel spokesman soon after S P s announcement pct notes been priced at par far cry late September when S P downgraded dlr issue subordinated sinking fund debentures due New World Pictures Ltd NWP just hours after pricing Because rating cut to CCC plus B minus underwriter halted sales repriced issue Sole manager L F Rothschild Unterberg Towbin initially gave debentures pct coupon par pricing then repriced issue at to yield pct New World Pictures increased issue to dlrs original offering dlrs brought S P agency cited larger financing action believed issuer s cash existing operations be enough to adequately service debt officer S P at time rating agency told beforehand issue been increased size Usually issuers underwriters alert rating agencies to any changes debt offerings he both cases Moody s Investors Service Inc declined to follow suit bond traders noted Indeed Moody s announced Friday original rating B Holiday Inns notes remained appropriate Moody s pointed out while seven year notes be unsecured obligations Holiday Inns issue benefit negative pledge provision call specified collateral under certain circumstances agency also B rating continued to recognize highly leveraged debt structure result Holiday s recapitalization program as well as company s dependence on property sales to produce adequate cash flow near term debt service Aside Holiday Inns New World Pictures I cannot remember time issue downgraded so soon after pricing remarked one corporate bond trader Holiday Inns also sold Thursday via Drexel dlrs subordinated debentures due pct coupon par pricing debentures ratings B by Moody s B minus by S P were left unchanged on Friday combined offering billion dlrs second largest junk bond deal ever brought to market underwriters traders They biggest BCI Holdings billion dlr offering on April Holiday Inns deal sold out quickly underscored appetite many investors high yield securities People hungry yield They worried downside risk at all especially junk bonds issued by well known companies one portfolio manager As result investors expected to snap up week s planned offerings by Allied Stores Corp dlrs senior notes due rated B B dlrs senior subordinated debentures due rated B CCC plus Lead underwriter First Boston Corp Friday tentatively scheduled securities pricing today

Economic Club Detroit Roderick There should be total resolve dollar versus other major currencies as well as currencies other nations having substantial trade surplus us must continue to decline so correction our trade deficit starts on road to recovery Roderick U S should be understanding economic pain our trading partners experience as result falling dollar But he added As painful as correction may be to our trading partners less painful than leaving problem uncorrected because lead us into inevitable lengthy steep world recession Roderick between February December dollar fell by more than pct real terms against major industrial currencies by to pct against broader group currencies nearly all developing nations At end he value foreign assets U S exceeded value U S assets abroad by billion dlrs compared to five years ago when U S surplus assets billion company spokesman data were provided by economic consultants to USX primary reason trade imbalance pct rise dollar between although other factors were involved Roderick But wrong he to attribute massive trade deficit to fundmental deterioration U S productivity or American product quality These areas need to be improved but they root cause trade gap problem Roderick He urged American manufacturers to become more competitive so they can compete global markets speech USX chairman also called changes securities laws to curb what he called abuses by corporate raiders speculators Among his proposals he presented to Senate Banking Committee testimony week were requirement raiders give hour notice every one pct stock they acquire company Roderick proposed tender offers must be made all cash to all stockholders on equal terms raiders be required to financing place before tender made Further raiders should be required to make all cash tender offer once they acquire pct target company s stock he payment greenmail or preferential price by target company to buy back raider s stake should be prohibited under revised laws Roderick changes were necessary to curb abuses but he did want laws hurt financial markets or discourage fair price to all takeovers

text.body: McDonnell Douglas Corp recent talks Airbus Industries joint development production new jetliner European aircraft manufacturing consortium been very informal If there been talks they were casual at best source at company There nothing going on lead to immediate or near term collaboration on new plane Senior officials at aerospace firm s St Louis headquarters were unable to comment more specifically on weekend published reports Europe talks joint venture resumed after they broke off fall McDonnell Douglas Airbus spring summer discussed jointly developing building long range aircraft to compete Boeing Co BA wide body jetliner or successor Talks ended when neither side wanted to forego plans to launch own widebody jetliner projects McDonnell Douglas MD Airbus A McDonnell Douglas since launched MD jetliner successor to DC more than orders options Airbus wants to launch program spring now seeking customers long range A companion plane shorter range A I don t want to say we re interested because we any collaboration benefits McDonnell Douglas without giving up anything source told Reuters There just haven t been depth discussions He any joint venture affect MD program already underway McDonnell Douglas month claimed Airbus tried to overturn pledges made by airlines to buy MD by offering cut rate prices A firm Airbus effort to line up enough customers to launch program engaging predatory practices prices substantially below those needed to recover cost developing building plane U S government aerospace industry officials believe Airbus can offer low prices because consortium gets government subsidies cover many costs Reagan Administration decided month to consult General Agreement on Tariff Trade GATT to determine whether Airbus unfairly subsidized Under GATT rules enterprise can be subsidized but only if make profit U S officials say Airbus countries poured billion dlrs into Airbus since early s consortium yet to make profit

text.title: BANKS TO MULL PHILIPPINE DEBT PROPOSAL
text.body: The Philippines bank advisory committee meets tomorrow to discuss response to novel proposal by finance minister Jaime Ongpin to pay part country s interest bill investment notes instead cash bankers Ongpin outlined his plan today to bank advisory committee headed by Manufacturers Hanover Trust Co Bankers declined to comment on today s meeting but panel s response could be crucial to fate talks now their second week The ball s our court now one banker on committee Under Ongpin s rescheduling plan Philippines offer to make interest payments cash at pct over London Interbank Offered Rate Banks found rate unacceptably low be offered alternative LIBOR payments cash plus margin one pct form Philippine Investment Notes PINs bankers explained These tradable dollar denominated zero coupon notes maturity six years but they be redeemable at any time at par pesos to fund investments approved as part government s debt equity scheme Because banks be able to sell PINs to multinational investors at relatively small discounts to face value their total yield be boosted well above pct cash margin according to Philippine proposal Although bankers eager to foster foreign investment Philippines PINs idea likely to run into stiff resistance by at least some members bank advisory committee because establish precedent some interest payments being made paper rather than cash Ongpin U S regulators accountants given green light to his idea but bankers so sure U S bankers fear they be able to account notes same way as accruing cash interest payments their profits suffer accordingly If banks reject proposal out hand however they run risk scuttling talks Ongpin insisted he accept margin above pct Phillipines asking banks to reschedule billion dlrs debt falling due between to grant easier terms on billion dlrs previously restructured debt

text.body: The search continued cargo poisonous chemical substances loaded on Herald Free Enterprise Ferry capsized Zeebrugge harbour Friday total drums various toxic materials were loaded on trucks ship s hold been recovered but Belgian authorities warned essential to recover further containers cyanide based solution net been thrown over gaping loading doors at front ship to prevent any more drums floating out Salvage workers moved cranes into place alongside wreck ton roll on roll off ferry now lies partly submerged on sandbank outside harbour ferry s owner European Ferries Plc majority owned by Peninsular Oriental Steam Navigation Co Plc PORL L operation to right vessel began yesterday after divers abandoned their search more bodies Experts could take months to refloat ship free bodies estimated to be trapped amid debris The problem these waters you can normally expect one working day out four Daan Kaakebeen Dutch Salvage experts Smit Tak International Rotterdam He estimated job itself require working days Using reinforced cables salvage experts intend to raise ship set down into trench dug alongside Salvage work could pinpoint exact cause loss ferry one three sister vessels plying cross Channel routes England to continental Europe Suspicion at present focused on ferry s main vehicle loading doors set close to water level London Transport Secretary John Moore told parliament yesterday ship keeled over after water gushed through bow doors He major government inquiry into disaster be held all similar ferries sailing Britain be inspected owners be asked to fit lights to give warning if bow doors properly closed Experts carrying out tank computer tests to determine how accident occurred focus attention on ship s doors ballast system crew procedures he added Two other investigations into disaster also begun one Belgian one by ferry s owners

text.author: By Linda Sieg Reuters
text.body: Japanese microchip makers being strong armed into compliance U S Japan pact on semiconductors halting predatory pricing opening Japan s market to foreign chips industry analysts But doubts remain over whether Ministry International Trade Industry MITI pressuring firms can successfully battle market forces whether U S Industry geared up to take advantage any breathing space they U S Threats to scrap agreement signed September pushed MITI to try harder to get recalcitrant Japanese chipmakers to abide by pact analysts MITI been moving hot heavy throughout industry to get things done Bache Securities Japan associate vice president Peter Wolffe month MITI told chipmakers to cut production January to March period by pct to help dry up inexpensive chips escaped Japan to grey markets subject to pact s price controls ministry also asked electronics firms to provide distributors certificates designating them as authorised exporters effort to close loopholes through grey marketeers sneak chips out Japan market analysts U S Trade negotiators here week pact jeopardy because continued dumping non American markets little sign increased foreign sales Japan But major Japanese firms appear to agreed to production cuts several analysts week NEC Corp cut production line MITI s request NEC been most aggressive resisting MITI s demands David Keller analyst at James Capel Co Once NEC cuts production means they all Still pressures remain to keep production high Japanese firms need high output to cut unit prices U S Sales Commerce Department assigns them under pact The best way to lower cost to produce more Salomon Brothers Asia Ltd analyst Carole Ryavec Preparations possible upturn demand could also spur higher production next quarter Merrill Lynch analyst Matt Aizawa Grey marketeers may also be able to outfox any new restrictions some industry officials It s like tax avoidance schemes Steve Donovan head MMI Japan K K As soon as you close one route another opens MITI s pressure annoyed some makers who earlier shrugged off MITI guidance It s getting to be like communism one But analysts output cuts could help by making easier to increase prices as planned on April forcing firms to stop extending market share by selling at loss They re going to to start running their businesses like businesses Bache s Wolffe MITI also been conducting highly public campaign urging chip users to buy foreign made chips but U S Industry officials response been mixed at best There been some change but s across board one U S Spokesman The companies varying degree urgency ultimate impact all these efforts by MITI on troubled U S Industry remains doubt analysts added Pressure to cut production kilobit DRAM dynamic random access memory chips could merely speed transition to one megabit chips where Japan now leads analysts Whether U S Firms able to stage comeback memory chips or interested doing so also remains unclear they Analysts watching interest fate new U S Consortium hopes to challenge Japan by developing most advanced technology microchip manufacturing Even thorny area access much depends on U S Commitment as well as on Japanese openness some The SIA U S Semiconductor Industry Association doesn t even office here source close to industry You could question just how committed they addition some industry analysts question effectiveness bilateral agreement leaves out third country chipmakers such as those South Korea South Korea s gaining market share one analyst They re real winners agreement

fall he quoted at today little changed year ago official China taken measures to improve export performance including incentive offers to exporters establishment export production bases We expect higher prices our oil exports year he added Official estimates put China s export losses drop world oil prices at three billion dlrs Western diplomat China s foreign debt needs careful management but debt service ratio remains very low at six to eight pct We base our assessment on China s foreign exchange reserves but on export performance just as you assess company on performance bank account he reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC NAKASONE SET TO STAY

text.title: NAKASONE SET TO STAY UNTIL TAX REFORM APPROVED
text.author: By Yuko Nakamikado Reuters
text.body: Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone step down only after his plan to overhaul Japan s tax system gets parliamentary approval one his closest aides today aide who declined to be identified at private meeting Nakasone s power office does necessarily terminate at end his term October depends on when the seven tax reform bills get parliamentary approval Nakasone vowed yesterday to press on his plan despite Sunday s unexpected Upper House by election defeat ruling Liberal Democratic Party LDP conservative stronghold socialist winner backed by other opposition parties campaigned against controversial five pct value added sales tax main plank reform plans aide dismissed possibility any amendment sales tax on grounds opposition parties were demanding nothing but retraction tax They been refusing to discuss draft budget fiscal year starting on April includes tax plans They been resorting to on off boycott parliament since February If I were Nakasone I close current regular parliamentary session on May as scheduled attend Venice summit industrial democracies June open extraordinary session to discuss tax plans aide Under law regular session can be extended only once while extraordinary session can be extended twice The other option be to extend current session he The opposition parties surely present no confidence motion against Nakasone Cabinet at one stage or another One scenario then be to reject motion opening up way tax reform Another scenario resignation Nakasone Cabinet en masse third scenario dissolution Lower House snap general election aide only possible if opposition members resign seat Lower House necessitating by elections LDP now seats Lower House after landslide victory general elections July There five independents three vacancies The LDP put up candidates certainly inflate their seats but at expense fierce media criticism aide He he expected proposed sales tax to little effect on local elections to be held on April elections be held all but three nation s prefectures including gubernatorial elections Candidates running prefectural assemblies all oppose sales tax irrespective their party tickets Possible effects if any be on gubernatorial elections Japan s northernmost island Hokkaido Fukuoka southern Japan he two posts now held by opposition socialists

text.title: KOREA PLANS TO OPEN MARKETS TO EASE WON PRESSURE
text.body: South Korea further open market to help cut trade surplus U S to fight off pressure to revalue won against dollar government spokesman spokesman Korean trade minister Rha Woong Bae s stand Washington yesterday against pressure industrial nations to revalue won underlined government s determination to stand firm Rha told U S Chamber Commerce Demands Korea carry out drastic sudden currency revaluation five or pct I believe extremely ill advised Deputy prime minister Kim Mahn Je told meeting local businessmen The government s policy on question revaluing won to maintain steadfast position Kim South Korea ready to move slowly to raise won s value because heavy foreign debt stood at billion dlrs at end Six industrialised nations agreed Paris month newly industrialising countries such as South Korea Taiwan should allow their currencies to appreciate But local businessmen won dollar parity already reached a crisis level official Korea Traders Association KTA if won strengthened another five pct mean loss profitability nearly half all South Korean exporters We determined to go way Latin American debtor nations suspended interest payments their debts spokesman The only way to keep our good record to maintain our exports trade minister yesterday should Seoul revalue won suddenly Korea run a tremendous trade deficit could degenerate into country like many other developing countries reneging on international obligations spokesman South Korea been gradually appreciating currency ruling out major revaluation So far year won gone up by pct against dollar after pct revaluation He South Korea selecting many items on Washington recently asked Seoul to lower tariffs to help narrow trade surplus U S No further details were given Seoul announced January lifting bans on items including sensitive agricultural products large cars effective July South Korea posted first ever current account surplus year due largely to trade surplus U S billion dlrs against billion deficit earlier forecast current account surplus could reach eight billion dlrs year But government official surplus be held at around five billion dlrs to avoid further pressure by industrialised nations to push up value currency

text.body: OPEC reaffirmed commitment to fixed crude oil prices around dlrs barrel overall output ceiling barrels per day bpd to defend prices president Rilwanu Lukman He told news conference here After due consultation my colleagues OPEC I hereby wish to emphasize Nigeria all member countries OPEC remain determined to uphold December agreement by adhering strictly to their various quotas official selling prices Lukman added no extraordinary OPEC conference planned We position to re confirm despite misleading news foreign media to contrary OPEC member countries as whole produced below their agreed quota month February Lukman who Nigerian oil minister Lukman put overall OPEC output shortfall February at bpd as result their firm determination to defend official selling prices dlrs agreed upon December Geneva December agreement set overall output ceiling OPEC bpd first half restored fixed prices as February around reference point dlrs Oil prices rallied immediately after Geneva accord but fell again month on reports OPEC producing more than agreed level The idea to suggest OPEC s agreement hold caused some customers to hold back purchases OPEC oil resort to destocking to meet their needs Lukman He bpd shortfall February based on verified figure out OPEC s members adding Nigeria alone shortfall production bpd Iraq disassociated itself December agreement while production figures Ecuador United Arab Emirates needed to be verified Lukman If price we to pay to make agreement succeed we ready OPEC changing price level dlrs group s president He OPEC price differentials committee meeting formerly postponed to April been put off indefinitely Furthermore no extraordinary meeting conference at moment contemplated since most agreements reached December being adhered to he Asked if committee did need to meet soon to narrow gaps prices various OPEC crudes fixed relation to dlr benchmark Lukman replied We consider defence our prices much more crucial than differentials Lukman OPEC aware consumers heavily drawn on stocks both crude oil refined products to levels well below time year soon they return to market search crude We don t see there going to be any difficulty maintaining dlr price throughout rest year Lukman OPEC president praised non OPEC oil producers he contributed to group s efforts to stabilise prices but he criticised Britain maintaining long held view to do anything to help market We quite confident however long term two thirds world s reserves OPEC hands future ours We use advantage responsibly he Lukman described reuters.unknown: A f reute h f BC NAKASONE SET TO STAY

text.title: NAKASONE SET TO STAY UNTIL TAX REFORM APPROVED
text.author: By Yuko Nakamikado Reuters
text.body: Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone step down only after his plan to overhaul Japan s tax system gets parliamentary approval one his closest aides today aide who declined to be identified at private meeting Nakasone s power office does necessarily terminate at end his term October depends on when the seven tax reform bills get parliamentary approval Nakasone vowed yesterday to press on his plan despite Sunday s unexpected Upper House by election defeat ruling Liberal Democratic Party LDP conservative stronghold socialist winner backed by other opposition parties campaigned against controversial five pct value added sales tax main plank reform plans aide dismissed possibility any amendment sales tax on grounds opposition parties were demanding nothing but retraction tax They been refusing to discuss draft budget fiscal year starting on April includes tax plans They been resorting to on off boycott parliament since February If I were Nakasone I close current regular parliamentary session on May as scheduled attend Venice summit industrial democracies June open extraordinary session to discuss tax plans aide Under law regular session can be extended only once while extraordinary session can be extended twice The other option be to extend current session he The opposition parties surely present no confidence motion against Nakasone Cabinet at one stage or another One scenario then be to reject motion opening up way tax reform Another scenario resignation Nakasone Cabinet en masse third scenario dissolution Lower House snap general election aide only possible if opposition members resign seat Lower House necessitating by elections LDP now seats Lower House after landslide victory general elections July There five independents three vacancies The LDP put up candidates certainly inflate their seats but at expense fierce media criticism aide He he expected proposed sales tax to little effect on local elections to be held on April elections be held all but three nation s prefectures including gubernatorial elections Candidates running prefectural assemblies all oppose sales tax irrespective their party tickets Possible effects if any be on gubernatorial elections Japan s northernmost island Hokkaido Fukuoka southern Japan he two posts now held by opposition socialists

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC NATIONAL SAVINGS MOVE

text.title: NATIONAL SAVINGS MOVE POINTS TO LOWER U K RATES
text.author: By Geert Linnebank Reuters
text.body: U K Interest rates look set to move lower even after Monday s half point cut bank base rates to pct analysts citing as evidence suspension British National Savings issue yesterday Department National Savings effectively Treasury Department unit yesterday suspended nd issue launched October paying high tax free pct on five year private investments between stg spokesman suspension just reaction to yields on national savings bonds being way out line rest market move followed by surprise sell out within minutes today Bank England one billion stg tap issue second such issue as many weeks analysts noted They near instant sale entire new gilts issue Bank England required high pct downpayment clear evidence market thought rates to drop sooner rather than later sale tranche pct treasury bonds due occurred active bullish gilts market as downward pressure on money market rates remained intact bellwether three month interbank rate down point at pct coincided another strong sterling rally pushed pound to four year highs against dollar That government stock disappeared very quickly indeed Stephen Lewis head economic research at stockbrokers Phillips Drew It indication market believes rates going to fall further At least by half point immediately after budget on March some people hope more Stockbrokers James Capel comment move by National Savings Department of considerable significance the real message decks being quickly cleared so as to facilitate speedy decision by building societies to cut their rates when inevitable cut bank base rates to pct materialises Building societies drop bank base rates normally to exceed half point to give rise to reduction mortgage lending rates Lewis Phillips Drew he too believed National Savings issue suspension may reflect new U K Treasury policy to point building societies towards mortgage rate cut National Savings been competing too effectively building societies late Building society income been depressed recent months he He other analysts Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson keen to see mortgage rates fall to keep lid on U K Inflation Underlying upward pressure on prices stronger Britain than most other Western economies inflation seen rising well above four pct year above five pct after year s pct Emphasising impact mortgage rates on consumer prices Lewis one point cut building society rates reduce inflation Britain by pct But Lewis others noted building societies been complaining to government intense competition National Savings they argued reduced scope early mortgage rate cuts The Chancellor need be worried losing some PSBR funding National Savings but he must be taking building societies criticism to heart looks like National Savings move reflects one senior dealer Savings Department spokesman refused to comment on interpretation saying suspension issue merely reaction to recent fall U K Interest rates pushed yields on national savings bonds way out line rest market We politically motivated Funding just becoming too expensive we don t need all money he told Reuters adding department suspended issues at least twice past when offered interest rates were above or below market rates He demand issue risen sharply late as U K Money market rates continued their steady decline income threatening to overshoot unofficial three billion stg target set fiscal ending March first months fiscal National Saving s contribution to government funding totalled billion stg compared billion stg same period previous year official figures show Figures February out on Monday expected to show further increase between stg pushing total months above target government officials

text.title: CHRYSLER C SELLS BONDS FROM ITS PORTFOLIO
text.body: Chrysler Corp today sold dlrs corporate bonds nearly billion dlr pension fund to Wall Street investment bankers vice president treasurer Fred Zuckerman He first two planned sales corporate issues fund s portfolio Zuckerman Chrysler sell slightly less than one billion dlrs corporates Phase two the second sale be month or so Chrysler executive adding proceeds be invested exclusively equities market Before today s sale corporate bonds those securities comprised roughly two thirds pension fund portfolio After two sales equities amount to pct or more portfolio Zuckerman We believe equity market much more upside potential than bond market executive Interest rates coming down I bet lot they drop sharply He added I personally think interest rates may decline by basis points at most year Zuckerman dlr bond sale composed separate issues Sixty pct were utilities pct were issued by foreign governments or corporations pct were financial institutions he detailed Chrysler treasurer corporate paper typically year maturity The securities were long term high quality bonds mostly rated AA minus or plus he Zuckerman Chrysler sold corporate bonds at pct above yesterday s closing prices these issues That showed our portfolio desirable he commented Corporate bond traders noted Chrysler s sale occurred against backdrop slightly weak secondary market They they believed Chrysler sold corporates at large profit because issues were bought by automaker portfolio when interest rates were much higher Chrysler s Zuckerman his company sold corporate issues to four large Wall Street securities firms He Morgan Stanley Co Inc Salomon Brothers Inc bought most bonds However Zuckerman declined to name other two houses Yesterday Chrysler presented four investment bankers list bonds asked them to submit bids by morning Zuckerman Morgan Stanley bought more corporate bonds than any one other three houses Wall Street sources they believed First Boston Corp Merrill Lynch text.title: WALL STREET STOCKS TENNECO INC TGT
text.body: Tenneco Inc company long been rumored to be takeover candidate rose sharply today when speculation surfaced investor T Boone Pickens may be targeting company acquisition traders analysts Tenneco spokesman Joseph Macrum we no comment to make whatsoever Pickens available comment Traders noted activity stock increased today after published report linked Pickens to Tenneco Tenneco rose two points to Paul Feretti analyst New Orleans based Howard Weil Labouisse Friedrichs Inc he surprised at market rumors Tenneco might be target takeover attempt It s pure market speculation Boone Pickens his group may be interested Feretti But Tenneco be challenge to run because sheer size diversity Mr Pickens man who likes challenge Pickens who made unsuccessful attempt to take over Dallas based Diamond Shamrock Corp DIA winter made no secret his plans to acquire additional natural gas reserves belief gas prices stabilize sooner than oil prices Tenneco holds natural gas reserves estimated excess trillion cubic feet analysts Feretti conservatively estimated Tenneco s breakup value at dlrs share company generated cash flow dlrs share which probably very attractive to Pickens Other analysts however estimate breakup value well into dlr share range I strongly doubt there going to be any hostile takeover Drexel Burnham Lambert Inc s Houston based analyst John Olson putting little credence rumors Tenneco gargantuan enterprise seven billion dlrs long term debt preferred stock outstanding He buyer also to deal the intractable problems Tenneco faces farm equipment unit energy businesses Analysts suggested Tenneco could use number defensive strategies to fend off unwanted buyer such as spin off some non energy businesses directly to shareholders buy back shares or create limited partnership out natural gas pipeline interests analyst who asked to remain unidentified discouraged Pickens rumor Pickens plateful already his holdings Burlington Northern Amerada Hess he I don t think he be willing to take on Tenneco s problems Case the farm equipment unit been losing dlrs annually worth less than billion dlrs on market today

reuters.unknown: C G L M T f reute r f AM BRAZIL STRIKES

text.title: BRAZIL S SARNEY MEETS STRIKES WITH SHOW OF FORCE
text.author: By Stephen Powell Reuters
text.body: With troops place Brazil s ports oil installations government Prersident Jose Sarney today sought to end wave labour unrest by show force Yesterday government sent thousands troops supported some instances by tanks to occupy nine oil refineries six areas oil production state oil company Petrobras requested intervention because threatened strike by oil industry employees government already dispatched more than marines to occupy country s main ports after national seamen s strike ruled illegal Friday strike by seamen now th day represents stern challenge to government stoppage delayed exports at time when Brazil desperately needs foreign exchange deterioration country s trade balance precipitated Brazil s current debt crisis decision on February to suspend interest payments on billion dlrs commercial debt There no sign today early end to seamen s strike badly hit port Santos most important South America country s other main ports Small groups marines armed submachineguns stand on quays near strike bound ships but military presence here generally discreet total marines inside docks but most out sight Yesterday marines police occupied one ship Docemarte seamen s leaders After explaining to captain strikers faced up to one year jail because strike illegal men returned to work One strike leaders Elmano Barbosa it psychological war They using force we using peaceful methods Port sources only two Brazilian ships Santos Docemarte Henrique Leal were working At seamen s national strike headquarters Rio de Janeiro spokesmen say total ships strike bound Brazil foreign ports Contradicting earlier reports strike headquarters Rio de Janeiro seamen Santos strikers on board ships here were running out food current labour unrest worst faced by Sarney s civilian government since came to power two years ago Yesterday separate protest hundreds thousands farmers held rallies directed largely against high bank interest rates current rash labour unrest industry agriculture stems failure government s now collapsed Cruzado Plan price freeze

reuters.unknown: F f reute r f AM MERGERS

text.title: ADMINISTRATION SAID LAX ON ANTITRUST ENFORCEMENT
text.body: A group state officials key U S senator corporate merger wave harming economy blamed Reagan administration laxness enforcing federal antitrust laws Sen Howard Metzenbaum Ohio Democrat who chairs Senate Judiciary Committee s Antitrust Subcommittee also cautioned Department Justice DOJ to comply his request listing each case since department officials rejected staff recommendation to prosecute suspected antitrust violation Metzenbaum asked data by Monday but DOJ failed to meet deadline later hinted might refuse to comply Acting Assistant Attorney General Antitrust Charles Rule defended administration s record on antitrust enforcement told panel at today s hearing department process preparing response to Metzenbaum s request We nothing to hide but we to be concerned our institutional interests Rule He provided no explanation what those interests were Metzenbaum he scheduled hearings requested data out concern that administration abandoned nation s historical commitment to effective antitrust enforcement The green light on he Merger mania rampant country and serving us well Rule countered low inflation interest rates continuing economic expansion meant administration s policies were working well He simply looking at number challenges filed against pending mergers misleading because there no reason to believe fixed proportion all mergers were anticompetitive If you look at individual cases rather than statistics you see we appropriately enforcing antitrust laws Rule Metzenbaum s view however bolstered by National Association Attorneys General group top state law enforcement officials The federal assault on antitrust been comprehensive Robert Abrams attorney general New York chairman group s antitrust committee told panel The reduction enforcement been exacerbated by federal attempts to prevent both state attorneys general private parties enforcing law accordance clear meaning Supreme Court interpretations Abrams group drafted own merger guidelines to bring uniformity to attorney generals efforts to enforce laws at state level

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute r f BC SOUTH KOREA TO MAINTA

text.title: SOUTH KOREA TO MAINTAIN TRADE SURPLUS YEARS
text.author: By Robert Trautman Reuters
text.body: South Korean Trade Minister Rha Woong Bae his nation maintain trading surplus three to five years as way to cut foreign debt He interview Reuters after few years likely South Korea drop barriers to foreign goods move toward more balanced trade position He present trade surplus vital if his nation to reduce billion dlr foreign debt Rha first year South Korea trade surplus billion dlrs against deficit dlrs Asked if South Korea drop trade barriers once foreign debt substantially reduced he yes I think so Rha made his remarks at end two week trade mission here during team he led agreed to buy U S products valued at billion dlrs dlrs purchases goods type South Korea normally bought Japan Rha to leave later today Ottawa trade talks Canadian officials businessmen He interview U S purchases were to reduce his country s billion dlr surplus United States also to cut billion dlr shortfall Japan Rha also due to shift exchange rates between U S dollar yen made cheaper to buy U S goods than Japanese goods He South Korea heavily relied on foreign trade he hoped leaders major trading nations could find way to resolve growing trend toward protectionist legislation Rha I hope leaders can get together to find solution by making some mutually satisfactory concessions But he added the leaders seem hesitant to make concessions because domestic political reasons Speaking his own country he We made lot concessions already He cited regulations permitting foreign investment industrial firms allowing increased foreign banking activity cracking down on piracy intellectual property by strengthening protection copyrights patents Rha South Korea also lowered many tariffs Asked if South Korea retaliate against U S goods if Congress closed U S markets to products he at moment we no thought retaliation South Korea major exporter to United States textiles apparel electronic goods such as television sets video cassette records personal computers puchases United States include electronic testing equipment grains cotton trade mission s purchases here included three Boeing passenger planes dlrs four McDonnell Douglas planes dlrs machinery worth dlrs

reuters.unknown: F A RM f reute r f BC BUDGET

text.title: HOUSE DEMOCRATS DRAFTING BUDGET AT SNAIL S PACE
text.author: By Irwin Arieff Reuters
text.body: Democrats on House Budget Committee meeting behind closed doors to draft outlines next year s federal budget say their work proceeding at snail s pace series interviews panel members conceded budget panel s drafting sessions began yesterday were initially expected to end late tomorrow now extend into next week We ve long ways to go Rep Martin Frost D Tex told Reuters We making progress we should Rep Vic Fazio D Calif Members also acknowledged panel s preliminary goal spending cuts new revenues be enough to enable government to meet billion dlr deficit ceiling set coming year by federal law Budget Commitee Chairman William Gray D Pa interviewed during break lawmakers secret deliberations committee still debating shape overall budget come to no agreement on size or precise form new revenues or spending cuts to be pursued But lawmakers House Democratic leadership asked panel to come up package billion dlrs deficit reducing measures package include billion dlrs new revenues nine billion dlrs military spending cuts nine billion dlrs domestic spending reductions they Democratic lawmakers they were still trying to meet those goals but made no firm decisions particular legislators they were having trouble coming up nine billion dlrs military spending cuts We re talking range billion dlrs new revenues but if we can t come up full amount defense cuts we to raise more new revenues Fazio particular manner new revenues be raised also been decided lawmakers House Speaker Jim Wright D Texas urged passage tax on securities transactions to bring estimated billion dlrs new revenues into U S Treasury But administration totally opposed to such tax top official told Reuters yesterday official who spoke on condition he be identified administration also opposed another suggestion by Wright administration delay next year s cut top tax rate called recent tax overhaul law Congressional Democrats first hinted two weeks ago they seek to reduce deficit by billion dlrs put aside question whether effort meet billion dlr deficit target set fiscal year by new federal balanced budget law administration predicted approval billion dlrs deficit reductions meet target budget plan submitted January called trillion dlrs spending on revenues billion dlrs But Congressional Budget Office administration forecast based on overly optimistic assumptions economy nonpartisan office administration s budget plan if adopted yield deficit billion dlrs missing deficit target by billion dlrs

text.author: By Manuel Villanueva Reuters
text.body: Heavy rains fell again Argentina s main grain growing areas week to yesterday trade sources Rains fell heaviest early week particularly high volume Buenos Aires province Cordoba La Pampa Santa Fe provinces Rainfall totalled between mm Buenos Aires heaviest western sectors province to mm La Pampa to mm Cordoba to mm Santa Fe Rainfall lighter other provinces Rainfall totalled five to mm Corrientes five to mm San Luis five to mm Entre Rios three to mm Misiones to mm Formosa one to eight mm Chaco Growers still too early to tell whether rains damaged crops though they maize sunflower crops may suffered Harvesting both those crops sorghum paralysed by bad weather harvesting to resume as normal rains to stop long enough soil to dry allow farm machinery to operate rains caused flooding western northwestern Buenos Aires as more than mm fallen some areas there since February while annual average mm Flooded areas total between hectares Buenos Aires province governor Alejandro Armendariz after flying over flooded area Agriculture Secretary Ernesto Figueras only hectares area now flooded been planted to hectares could be lost Growers large parts flooded areas were planted because they low lying flood easily Trade sources certain crops were damaged by heavy rains but too early to tell exact extent damage They likely rain combined high winds uprooted many sunflower maize plants sunflower harvest moved forward centre south Cordoba Santa Fe got underway few isolated areas northern Buenos Aires Growers harvested between pct total planted area up seven to nine pct week ago Estimates total volume sunflower crop were revised downward light bad weather Estimates total crop ranged to tonnes down to tonnes estimated week down to pct year s record harvest tonnes Maize harvesting also advanced reaching between pct total planted area compared to seven to nine pct week ago maize harvest expected to total between tonnes down to tonnes estimated week ago year s maize text.title: PHILIPPINE DEBT TALKS DELAYED FOR CONSULTATIONS
text.body: Today s debt rescheduling talks between Philippines government bank advisory committee were postponed until Thursday to give banks more time to consider Manila s novel proposal paying part interest bill notes instead cash bankers committee banks met briefly earlier today decided they needed more time particular to consider news report quoted Reagan Administration official as urging proposal be given serious consideration The banks felt new information further consultation called one banker despatch yesterday Washington Reuters quoted official as saying Manila s plan to pay some interest notes could be converted into equity investments Philippines fully consistent Reagan Administration strategy handling developing country debt The Philippine proposal very interesting s quite unique I don t think s something should be categorically rejected out hand official Because key role U S plays debt crisis foreign banks particular wanted time to analyze significance policymaker s comments bankers

text.body: Harper Row Publishers Inc received acquisition offer Harcourt Brace Jovanovich INc to acquire all Harper Row s shares at dlrs share cash Harper consider proposal including such possible concerns as anti trust other legal considerations On Monday Harper Row received surprise dlr a share bid investor Theodore Cross owner six pct shares stock he does own Harcourt made clear offer step aside if Harper s directors shareholders reject bid Harper Harper board previously expressed strong determination to remain independent publishing enterprise Harper also New World Pictures shareholder requested copy Harper s shareholder list to be used soliciting proxies New World shares total shares Harper Row s stock closed off to after rising points yesterday Shareholders due to vote April on shareholders rights plan designed to thwart hostile takeovers Ivan Obolensky analyst investment banking Sterling Grace Co Harper Row one few remaining independent publishers back list authors stretching back years He as long as company maintains copyrights estates deceased authors controls all motion picture television rights to stories he new printing technologies make new editions profitable business Harcourt Brace needs back list nature willing to pay up Obolensky But he Harper Row has plenty beef to warrant dlr bid

reuters.unknown: F f reute r f BC PLAN TO CUT DELAYS AD

text.title: PLAN TO CUT DELAYS ADVANCES AT SEVEN AIRPORTS
text.body: The Department Transportation DOT go ahead at seven airports controversial plan to reduce airline delays by enabling competing companies to coordinate their schedules Under plan DOT grant airlines immunity antitrust laws so they can redistribute their flight times over day avoid clustering flights typically occurs at most desirable travel times Transportation Secretary Elizabeth Dole she decided to grant unconditional immunity to carriers serving Atlanta s Hartsfield Chicago s O Hare airports At five other airports Dallas Fort Worth Boston Denver Newark Philadelphia Dole she grant conditional immunity to enable further government study Under part plan carriers serving these five airports been asked to give DOT their summer schedules by end week agency then review schedules decide by Monday whether they threaten to cause delays If so those airports be added to list those granted wider immunity to enable scheduling talks Dole she confident no anticompetitive effects result talks she be monitored by U S officials be open to public Flight delays at nation s busiest airports soared to government believes most delays caused by weather DOT first proposed immunity plan late January might be granted total airports Dropped final plan were Minneapolis St Paul New York LaGuardia New York J F Kennedy San Francisco St Louis Washington Dulles airports
